#Text=2. Cultivation of Berberis Plants
#Text=The genus Berberis include about 500 different species and commonly grown in Europe , United States , South Asia and some northern areas of Iran and Pakistan (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=) .
#Text=In Pakistan , majority of Berberis species are found in high mountains ( 1400 m – 3500 m above sea level ) .
#Text=In Iran , five Berberis species are present , including two important species , i.e. , B. orthobotrys and B. khorassanica , which are grown in eastern , northern and southern regions of Iran .
#Text=Other important local species zereshk is also widely cultivated in the South-Khorasan province of Iran .
#Text=In Iran , 11,000 hectares of area is under cultivation of common barberry ( B. vulgaris ) species , and one of the most leading producers of barberry fruit in the world .
#Text=Annually , Iran produces more than 10,000 tons of dried barberry fruits , while maximum production comes from the Southern Khorasan .
#Text=More than 97 % of the area located near Ghaenat County and Southern Khorasan province is cultivated with common barberry that produces 95 % of fruit in Iran .
#Text=B. vulgaris is gathered from the wild in Eastern Europe in countries like Poland .
#Text=In addition , it is known as K’otsakhuri in Georgia , where it is grown and collected from the southeast forests of the country .

#Text=The yield-related important traits of many Berberis species are significantly affected by environmental factors , biotic stresses , seasonal variations , the climatic condition of an area , planting and harvesting date or methods , irrigation source , fruit processing and storage methods , etc.
#Text=The fruit remains a vital part , producing many important secondary metabolites and used in pharmaceutical and food industries .
#Text=In this section , we have highlighted the cultivation of different Berberis species , its status and various factors affecting its cultivation .
#Text=Common barberry is a native plant in Asia ’s western and middle mountains and non-native to North America .
#Text=The hybrid species Berberis × ottawaensis are widely cultivated in Europe and North America .
#Text=The European settlers introduced common barberry to New England , and used it as a source of medicine , food , and for other aesthetic purposes .
#Text=The colonists of New England determined its cultivation spread Puccinia graminis fungus , causing wheat rust and important reduction of its crop .
#Text=The seedless type ( B. vulgaris var. asperma ) is commonly cultivated in the southern parts of the Khorasan province of Iran for domestic purposes .
#Text=B. lyceum represents a native species of Nepal and distributed in the temperate and subtropical regions of the world , including some part of Australia .
#Text=It is distributed from Kashmir to Uttaranchal North-western Himalayas .
#Text=Sixteen species , and some varieties of barberry , were found in the Boaxing country , situated on the Eastern side of Hengduan Mountains in Sichuan Province , Southwest China .
#Text=The Japanese barberry is invasive in twenty different states of the world and five other provinces of Canada .
#Text=According to Reference there are 21 Berberis species in Nepal , including two new species Berberis pendryi Bh . Adhikari and Berberis karnaliensis Bh . Adhikari .
#Text=Berberis crataegina DC .
#Text=is commonly grown in Turkey , Asia and European regions .
#Text=The fruit are locally known as “ karamuk ” and “ kadıntuzluğu ” in Turkey and used as traditional medicine .
#Text=In Pakistan , twenty species and six subspecies of Berberis have been reported , and the majority of these is growing in northern parts of the country .
#Text=The other dominant species of Berberis is B. aristata , grown in Nepal , Pakistan and India .
#Text=In Pakistan , it mainly cultivated in the Hazara division of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa ( KP ) , and Azad Jamu and Kashmir ( AJK ) regions .
#Text=In AJK it is locally named s umbal and commonly known as daruharidra .
#Text=B. lyceum is another key species , highly distributed in different Asian countries , including , Afghanistan , Pakistan , Nepal , India and Bangladesh .
#Text=In Pakistan , it grows in different areas of KP , Punjab and Baluchistan .
#Text=The fruit part locally called kashmal , is used as a source of food , and for preparing the sauce in Himalayan regions of Jammu and Kashmir , and Himachal Pradesh .
